DataElement.preferredName: MRI Non-mass Like Enhancement Centimeter Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Annotation used to indicate the size of an area of enhancement on MRI that does not belong to a 3D mass or have distinct features of a mass, measured in centimeters.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders._An area of enhancement on MRI that does not belong to a 3D mass or have distinct features of a mass. These lesions are characterized by their distribution, internal enhancement pattern, and symmetry (or lack thereof). (BI-RADS)

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

Concepts.definition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

Property.preferredDefinition: An area of enhancement on MRI that does not belong to a 3D mass or have distinct features of a mass. These lesions are characterized by their distribution, internal enhancement pattern, and symmetry (or lack thereof). (BI-RADS)

Concepts.definition: An area of enhancement on MRI that does not belong to a 3D mass or have distinct features of a mass. These lesions are characterized by their distribution, internal enhancement pattern, and symmetry (or lack thereof). (BI-RADS)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.origin: MCL:Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screened Lesions
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 3/8/22 jk released as part of quarterly content review and prior reviews with SMEs.  6-4-19 tt created for Breast initial diagnosis module.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch._Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A centimeter is a basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.:Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

Concepts.definition: A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.
Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

ValueDomain.origin: MCL:Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screened Lesions
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/7/22 jk released as part of quarterly content review and prior reviews with SMEs.  5-16-19 tt created for Breast surgical therapy module.
